MyHand
GITEICaptoglove.​Module
public
GITEICaptoglove.​MyHand

Handles Captoglove module configured as hand sensor.

Types
eHandType
public enum eHandType

List of possible ways to use Captoglove module with this class:

TYPE_RIGHT_HAND

As right hand sensor

TYPE_LEFT_HAND

As left hand sensor

Functions
MyHand
public MyHand(
int nID,
eHandType eType
)

Initializes variables for Captoglove module configuration.

Parameters
nID
int

Captoglove ID (4 digits number)

etype
eHandType

Captoglove use mode

Example
MyHand RightHand = new MyHand(2496, MyHand.eHandType.TYPE_RIGHT_HAND);
SetHandType
private void SetHandType(
eHandType eType
)

Saves Captoglove module use mode.

Parameters
eType
eHandType

Captoglove module use mode

Example
SetHandType(MyHand.eHandType.TYPE_RIGHT_HAND);
GetHandtype
public eHandType GetHandtype()
Returns

Captoglove module use mode

SetFingerAlgorithmReady
private void SetFingerAlgorithmReady(
bool b
)

Saves whether the algorithm for finger movement has been created or not.

Parameters
b
bool

true or false

Example
SetFingerAlgorithmReady(true);
Notes

Normally used after SetFingerAlgorithm() function is completed.

GetFingerAlgorithmReady
public bool GetFingerAlgorithmReady()
Returns
true

Finger algorithm has been created

false

Finger algorithm has NOT been created

SetOmittedDegrees
private void SetOmittedDegrees(
int nDegrees
)

Saves the number of degrees that must be omitted in the movement of the fingers to avoid shaking.

Parameters
nDegrees
int

Number of degrees that must be omitted in the movement of the fingers

Example
SetOmittedDegrees(2);
Notes

Usually small values between 0 and 5 to keep fast response in simulation.

GetOmittedDegrees
public int GetOmittedDegrees()
Returns

Number of degrees that are omitted in the movement of the fingers

SetHandTransform
public int SetHandTransform(
Transform tHandObj,
eModuleAxis ePitchAxis,
eModuleAxis eYawAxis,
eModuleAxis eRollAxis
)

Attaches Captoglove module movement to hand transform.

Parameters
tHandObj
Transform

Hand transform

ePitchAxis
eModuleAxis

Transform axis for pitch movement

eYawAxis
eModuleAxis

Transform axis for yaw movement

eRollAxis
eModuleAxis

Transform axis for roll movement

Returns
0

Success

-1

Error: Transform error

Example
SetHandTransform(transRH, Module.eModuleAxis.AXIS_X, Module.eModuleAxis.AXIS_Z, Module.eModuleAxis.AXIS_Y);
Notes

Place the hand transform horizontally in the scene before assigning it in this function.

SetFingerTransform
public int SetFingerTransform(
Transform tThumbObj,
Transform tIndexObj,
Transform tMiddleObj,
Transform tRingObj,
Transform tPinkyObj
)

Attaches Captoglove sensor movement to finger transform.

Parameters
tThumbObj
Transform

Thumb finger transform

tIndexObj
Transform

Index finger transform

tMiddleObj
Transform

Middle finger transform

tRingObj
Transform

Ring finger transform

tPinkyObj
Transform

Pinky finger transform

Returns
0

Success

-1

Error: Finger transform error

-2

Error: Child transform error

Example
SetFingerTransform(transThuR,transIndR,transMidR,transRinR, transPinR);
Notes

This function expects each finger transform to have at least 2 children to simulate phalanges movement.  Place the finger transform horizontally in the scene before assigning it in this function.

SetFingerSensor
private int SetFingerSensor(
int nThumbSensor,
int nIndexSensor,
int nMiddleSensor,
int nRingSensor,
int nPinkySensor,
int nPressureSensor
)

Saves the sensor ID assigned in Captoglove module to each finger.

Parameters
nThumbSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for thumb finger

nIndexSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for index finger

nMiddleSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for middle finger

nRingSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for ring finger

nPinkySensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for pinky finger

nPressureSensor
int

Captoglove sensor ID for pressure sensor

Example
SetFingerSensor(1, 3, 5, 7, 9, 2);
Returns
0

Success

-1

Error: Sensor ID error

Notes

Sensor ID can be verified in Captoglove documentation. Usually a number between 1 and 10.

SetDefaultRotLimits
private void SetDefaultRotLimits()

Set the limits for the rotation of the hand transform and each finger transform.

Notes

The values configured in this function are valid only for the hand model delivered with these libraries.

SetPitchLimits
private void SetPitchLimits(
float fMaxUpRotation,
float fMaxDownRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for pitch movement of the hand.

Parameters
fMaxUpRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing upward in the pitch movement

fMaxDownRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing downward in the pitch movement

Example
SetPitchLimits(90, -90);
Notes

These rotation values must be set as they are read in Unity enviroment for the hand transform.

SetYawLimits
private void SetYawLimits(
float fMaxRightRotation,
float fMaxLeftRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for yaw movement of the hand.

Parameters
fMaxRightRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing to the right in the yaw movement

fMaxLeftRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is pointing to the left in the yaw movement

Example
SetYawLimits(90, -90);
Notes

These rotation values must be set as they are read in Unity enviroment for the hand transform.

SetRollLimits
private void SetRollLimits(
float fMaxRightRotation,
float fMaxLeftRotation
)

Creates the algorithm for roll movement of the hand.

Parameters
fMaxRightRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is face up after turning it to the right.

fMaxLeftRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the hand is face up after turning it to the left.

Example
SetRollLimits(90, -90);
Notes

These rotation values must be set as they are read in Unity enviroment for the hand transform.

SetThumbRotLimits
private void SetThumbRotLimits(
float fMinRotation,
float fMaxRotation,
float fMinRotation1,
float fMaxRotation1,
float fMinRotation2,
float fMaxRotation2
)

Saves the rotation limits for the thumb finger transform.

Parameters
fMinRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the thumb finger is fully extended

fMaxRotation
float

Angle of rotation where the thumb finger is fully bent

fMinRotation1
float

Angle of rotation where the first child is fully extended

fMaxRotation1
float

Angle of rotation where the first child is fully bent

fMinRotation2
float

Angle of rotation where the second child is fully extended

fMaxRotation2
float

Angle of rotation where the second child is fully bent

Example
SetThumbRotLimits(-9.475f, -60, -6.888f, -50, -6.334f, -50);
Notes

These rotation values must be set as they are read in Unity enviroment for the finger transform.

float fMinRotation,

Angle of rotation where the second child is fully extended

Example
SetIndexRotLimits(-9.475f, -60, -6.888f, -50, -6.334f, -50);

MoveHand
public void MoveHand()

Updates hand transform rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() of your app to simulate hand movement.

MoveHandNoYaw
public void MoveHandNoYaw()

Updates hand transform rotation according with Captoglove module movement. Yaw movement is ommited.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() of your app to simulate hand movement.  Normally used when arm simulation is also running so the yaw movement is done by the arm.

SetHandNewAngle
private void SetHandNewAngle(
bool bYaw
)

Calculates hand transform rotation according with Captoglove module movement.

Parameters
bYaw
bool

true or false to simulate yaw movement

AsignAngle2Axes
private void AsignAngle2Axes(
float fPitchA,
float fYawA,
float fRollA
)

Set rotation angle to each axis of the hand transform.

MoveFingers
public void MoveFingers()

Updates each finger transform rotation according with Captoglove sensor movement.

Notes

Call this function in the Update() of your app to simulate fingers movement.

SetFingersNewAngle
private void SetFingersNewAngle()

Calculates each finger transform rotation according with Captoglove sensor movement.

SetFingerAlgorithm
private void SetFingerAlgorithm()

Creates algorithm for finger movement.

GetHandPosition
public Vector3 GetHandPosition()
Returns

Global position of hand transform

GetThumbPosition
public Vector3 GetThumbPosition()
Returns

Global position of thumb finger transform

GetIndexPosition
public Vector3 GetIndexPosition()
Returns

Global position of index finger transform

GetMiddlePosition
public Vector3 GetMiddlePosition()
Returns

Global position of middle finger transform

GetRingPosition
public Vector3 GetRingPosition()
Returns

Global position of ring finger transform

GetPinkyPosition
public Vector3 GetPinkyPosition()
Returns

Global position of pinky finger transform

IsSensorPressed
public bool IsSensorPressed()
Returns
true

Pressure sensor is being pressed

false

Pressure sensor is released

IsHandClosed
public bool IsHandClosed()
Returns
true

All fingers are bent more than 50%

false

All fingers are extended or bent less than 50%

FingerGesture1
public bool FingerGesture1()
Returns
true

Index finger is extended or bent less than 50% and the other fingers are bent more than 50%

false

Condition is not met

FingerGesture2
public bool FingerGesture2()
Returns
true

Index and middle finger are extended or bent less than 50% and the other fingers are bent more than 50%

false

Condition is not met

FingerGesture3
public bool FingerGesture3()
Returns
true

Index, middle and ring finger are extended or bent less than 50% and the other fingers are bent more than 50%

false

Condition is not met

SaveHandMovInFile
public void SaveHandMovInFile(
string sFileName
)

Saves module data in file with following format: x hand rotation; y hand rotation; z hand rotation

Parameters
sFileName
string

File name

Example
SaveHandMovInFile("RightHandMov.csv");
Notes

Call this function in Updated() of your app to save data continuously

SaveFingerMovInFile
public void SaveFingerMovInFile(
string sFileName
)

Saves sensor data in file with following format: thumb finger; index finger; middle finger; ring finger; pinky finger; pressure sensor

Parameters
sFileName
string

File name

Example
SaveFingerMovInFile("RightFingerMov.csv");
Notes

Call this function in Updated() of your app to save data continuously
